name: Threat Range
desc: Enabling Threat Range allows you to determine which enemies will attack the character's position by the color of the tile and threat lines displayed during movement.

name: Action Order
desc: Enabling Action Order allows you to know the action order with numbers displayed on characters, so you can better arrange tactics and strategies.

name: Backtrack
desc: If you made a mistake in decision or operation, you can use Backtrack to go back to the turn where the mistake occurred and reattempt the operation. You can also reattempt with Backtrack when you fail.

name: Tactical Skill
desc: Learn more Tactical Skills in the [Talent] system and equip them so you can use them in stages by consuming Tactic Points.

name: Tile Inquiry
desc: After selecting a tile, you can tap the tile icon at the bottom left of the screen to show information such as current tile effects and objects on the terrain.

name: Buff and Debuff
desc: During battle, open the Character panel and tap the Buff or Debuff icon to view detailed descriptions and duration of the character's current buffs and debuffs. Duration decreases by 1 after the character's turn.

name: Vertical Movement
desc: When a character enters tiles with a height difference ≥2, each step consumes 1 additional Movement; if the height difference along the path exceeds the character's jump power, they cannot pass through.

name: NRG Mechanics
desc: Most skills consume a character's NRG. At the end of the turn, 1 NRG is naturally restored, and some skills provide additional NRG restoration effects.

name: Role Counters
desc: There are counter relationships between character roles: Defender counters Seeker, Seeker counters Breaker, Breaker counters Defender, Watcher counters Destroyer, and Destroyer doesn't counter any role. Attacking a character in a countered role deals increased DMG, while attacking a character in a countering role deals decreased DMG.

name: Injured & Dying
desc: When a character's HP drops to a certain percentage, they will enter the [injured] state, causing a reduction in DMG dealt and an increase in DMG received. If their HP drops lower, the effects will be further enhanced.

name: Straight-Shot Block
desc: Skills with Straight Shot attacks can be blocked by enemy characters or objects in the attack trajectory. In such cases, you should adjust the positioning or destroy obstacles in advance to ensure the skill reaches its target.

name: Assassin Jump
desc: Some characters possess a Jump trait, which increases their jump power and allows them to traverse gaps of a 1-tile distance, enhancing their mobility.

name: Defeat with Terrain
desc: When a character is knocked into deep water, an abyss, or the void, they will be defeated immediately. Falling from a great height will cause DMG that increases with the height difference. Use this trick to your advantage to win in battle.

name: Alert Mechanics
desc: When a character uses a skill or triggers its own alert mechanism, an alert effect will be applied to a certain area. When enemy characters pass through the alert range, the effects of alert skills will be triggered.

name: Instant Skill
desc: When a character uses an instant skill, it does not end the current turn. They can still use the remaining Movement to move and attack after using the skill.

name: Terrain Transformation
desc: When a tile is affected by a skill that can change its effects, its terrain will transform into the corresponding effect. You can use terrain effects to your advantage to win in battle.

name: Impact DMG
desc: When a character is knocked back, if there are other characters, objects, or terrain with a height difference of more than 2 tiles in the path, the character will stop moving and receive additional DMG. Other characters or objects hit in the impact will also suffer some DMG.

name: Fall DMG
desc: When a character is knocked back, if there is a drop terrain with a height difference of more than 2 tiles in the path, the character will stop moving after falling and receive additional DMG.

name: Guard Mechanics
desc: When an ally character within a certain range is targeted by a single-target attack, a character with the ability Assisting Cover will swap positions with the target and take the attack on their behalf.

name: Charge Skill
desc: When a character uses a skill that requires preparation, they will prepare for a certain number of turns. During this time, the character cannot actively move or use other skills. After the preparation is complete, the powerful skill will be unleashed.

name: Shield
desc: If a character has a Shield, DMG of the corresponding type must first deplete their Shield Value before affecting their HP. When the DMG is completely absorbed by a Shield, certain debuffs may not have any effect on the target.

name: Reach Destination
desc: There are tiles with a special mark in certain stages. To fulfill the victory conditions, you need to have ally characters reach these positions.

name: Defeat Certain Targets
desc: There are enemy characters with a target mark in certain stages. Defeat them to fulfill the victory conditions.

name: Hold On
desc: The victory conditions of certain stages involve holding on for a specific number of turns. This is fulfilled if any ally character is still alive at the end of the required turns.

name: Explosive Barrel
desc: An Explosive Barrel explodes when it's attacked, causing significant DMG to a 3*3 area centered on itself. When knocked back, it explodes at the final position.

name: Wine Barrel
desc: When a Wine Barrel is attacked, it rolls in the direction of the attack. If it falls from a drop terrain with a height difference of 2 or more tiles or collides with a character or object, it stops and bursts, dealing DMG to the character in collision. After bursting, it leaves behind a 5*5 Liquor terrain centered on itself at the stopping position.

name: Boulder
desc: When a Boulder is attacked, it rolls in the direction of the attack. When it reaches a drop terrain with a height difference of 2 or more tiles, it falls and shatters. During its roll, it directly defeats any characters and destroys any objects it passes through.

name: Vlder Rattan Ball
desc: When a Vlder Rattan Ball is attacked, it rolls in the direction of the attack. If it falls from a terrain with a height difference of 2 or more tiles or collides with a character or object, it stops and bursts. The character in collision is pushed back, receives Piercing DMG, and is [Infected]. After bursting, the Rattan Ball leaves behind a cross-shape area of thorn bush centered on itself at the stopping position.

name: Banner
desc: Enemy or ally banners inspire all enemy or ally characters, increasing DMG dealt and reducing DMG taken. Defending ally banners and destroying enemy banners can help you win the battle.

name: Brazier
desc: When a Large Brazier is attacked, it pours flames in a 3*3 area in the direction of the attack, causing Scorch on the struck characters and igniting the terrain.

name: Cage
desc: When a Cage is destroyed, it releases its prisoner, but you don't know who is inside until it is destroyed.

name: Sachet
desc: When a Sachet is destroyed, it forms a 3*3 Spice terrain centered on itself. Characters on the terrain are guaranteed to dodge ranged single-target attacks. When the Spice terrain takes AoE DMG, it will be destroyed, dealing HP Percentage DMG to the characters within.

name: Burning
desc: When a character passes through or stays on a Burning terrain, they are afflicted with [scorch] for a certain number of turns. When walking on it, each tile consumes additional Movement.

name: Frosty
desc: When a character is knocked back on a Frosty terrain, they first slide to the edge of the ice before the knock-back effect takes place. When walking on it, each tile consumes additional Movement.

name: Spice
desc: Characters on a Spice terrain gain dodge. When a Spice terrain takes AoE DMG, it will be destroyed, dealing HP Percentage DMG to the characters within.

name: Liquor
desc: When a character passes through or stays on a Liquor terrain, they are afflicted with [Liquor] for a certain number of turns. When a Liquor terrain is attacked with [fire], it is ignited. When walking on it, each tile consumes additional Movement.

name: Crossbow Wall
desc: When activated, a Crossbow Wall shoots arrows in the direction it faces, dealing a percentage-based Piercing DMG to the first target along its path.

name: Fire Trap
desc: When activated, a Fire Trap releases flames in the direction it faces, causing Fire DMG to a rectangular area in front of it and inflicting [scorch] for a certain number of turns.

name: Minecart
desc: The Minecart travels along the track at fixed intervals, dealing significant DMG to units on its path. The track will flash red in the turn before the Minecart passes as a warning.

name: Beast Trap
desc: When a character passes through or stays on a trap, their action will be interrupted, and they will suffer a percentage-based Piercing DMG.

name: Spike
desc: When a character stays on a spike trap, they will receive a percentage-based Piercing DMG and have their Movement reduced for a certain number of turns.

name: Tarot Card
desc: When a character picks up a tarot card, they will gain [Act Again] and receive a buff based on the card type. It's important to note that enemy characters can also pick up tarot cards.

name: Aura
desc: In battles, there are two types of Aura: Common Aura and Leader's Aura, typically granted by Passive/Trait skills. When only one attribute is increased, the highest value takes effect. The Basic Attribute bonuses from different Leader's Auras cannot stack, while different Special Attributes they provide can. Moreover, Flag Effects like Tactics and Arenas can stack with any type of aura effect.

name: Damage Calculation
desc: Typically, the DMG dealt during an attack equals the [Attacker's] ATK minus the [Defender's] DEF. But if the [Attacker] has effects like [DMG Increase] or [DMG Reduction], the values of these effects will first be combined—adjusted to a minimum value of -50%—and then multiplied by the typical actual damage. The resulting value is subsequently multiplied by any [Vulnerability] or [DMG Reduction] effects inflicted upon the [Defender], with the total DMG Increase multiplier capped at 300%, to yield the final DMG.

name: Piercing DMG
desc: This type of damage directly reduces the target's HP, ignoring [DEF] and any [DMG Increase], [DMG Decrease], or [DMG Reduction] for both the attacker and defender. It is affected by the attacker's [Piercing DMG Dealt Modifier] and the target's [Piercing DMG Taken Modifier], and uses the same calculation method as Basic DMG. Note that [piercing DMG] can't crit.

name: DoT
desc: Enemies inflicted with abnormal states such as [scorch] and [Infection] will take damage over time (DoT). This damage is by default [piercing DMG] and is affected by the carrier's [Piercing DMG taken modifier] and [DoT taken modifier]. The effects are multiplied.

name: Environmental DMG
desc: Environmental DMG is a special type of DMG caused by objects, traps, and devices, such as Boulders, Explosive Barrels, and Beast Traps. It also includes damage from knocking back or falling off heights and is affected solely by the character's [Environmental DMG Taken Modifier].
